StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [sp_DeleteOCSClassAssignment]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@OCSID int, @UserLogin varchar(15) AS
SET NOCOUNT ON
DECLARE @DBID int DECLARE @DBNAME sysname DECLARE @ErrMsg varchar(100) DECLARE @DisplayRecord char(1)
--- INITIALIZE VARIABLES SELECT @DBID = DB_ID(), @DBNAME = DB_NAME()
--- CHECK THE DISPLAY RECORD FLAG SELECT @DisplayRecord = DISPLAY_RECORD FROM OCS WHERE OCS_ID = @OCSID
IF @DisplayRecord = 'Y' BEGIN SET @ErrMsg = 'An error occurred dele.ng the OCS class assignment for this applicant.' RAISERROR (@ErrMsg, 16, 1, @DBID, @DBNAME) RETURN END
IF EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM OCS WHERE OCS_ID = @OCSID AND DISPLAY_RECORD = 'N') BEGIN --- DELETE THE RECORD DELETE FROM OCS WHERE OCS_ID = @OCSID AND DISPLAY_RECORD = 'N'
IF @@ROWCOUNT != 1 BEGIN SET @ErrMsg = 'An error occurred dele.ng the OCS class assignment for this applicant.' RAISERROR (@ErrMsg, 16, 2, @DBID, @DBNAME) RETURN END END
IF @@ERROR != 0 BEGIN SET @ErrMsg = 'An error occurred dele.ng the OCS class assignment for this applicant.' RAISERROR (@ErrMsg, 16, 3, @DBID, @DBNAME) RETURN END
SET NOCOUNT OFF
